p: RBD located at the C-terminal domain of the spike protein mostly attaches to angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) located in the host cell membrane. ACE2 is mainly distributed in the epithelial cells of the lung and gastrointestinal tract. So, severe infection may occur in tissues with high expression levels of ACE2 including lung, intestine, kidney, and blood vessels [ 25].
